message: Anyone have good shortcuts/maps to say trim a line on 80 columns? Ideal hit would be smart enough to search backwards to find the next word and end line there.
Like the fmt utility on most Unixes?
If you just want to do it for one line, you can use gqq (I think--typing this on my iPod, so muscle memory doesn't quite work as well)
There's another command for doing a whole paragraph, and I believe it's gqap (same disclaimer as before)
@codekoala yes I want to do it for a single line.  I figure I can use macros or something to do more if I want, but need single first.  I'll try gqq, thanks!
@trimski yes very similar to fmt, maybe I can hack that somehow and run via script inside vim, but I'd rather keep it as a setting in my vimrc.
@codekoala ww gqq an gqap work perfectly! My only question is what does the second q mean?
The second q means format the current line.  See :help gq for more info.
I use the external program par with is a much better fmt
